refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The input operator works exactly the same way as load, except it does NOT store the data unless the INTO clause or the AFL store operator is present.

The instance_id argument allows you to select which SciDB instance you want to input into. To see a list of SciDB instances running on your system, use the list('instances') operator. For more details of the syntax, see .

informalexample.para: This example reads a SciDB-formatted file from the examples directory.--afl create array m4x4 <val1:int32, val2:int32>[i=0:3,4,0, j=0:3,4,0]; --show-output=no --afl input(m4x4,'../tests/harness/testcases/data/doc/m4x4_missing.txt'); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes
But note that the m4x4 array is emptyâ€”the data was not stored during the execution of the input operation.--afl scan(m4x4); --output-format=dense
